verb.description: Suggest or hint (something bad or reprehensible) in an indirect and unpleasant way.
examples: he was insinuating that I had no self-control

verb.description: Slide (oneself or a thing) slowly and smoothly into a position.
examples: the bugs insinuate themselves between one's skin and clothes

origin: Early 16th century (in the sense enter (a document) on the official register): from Latin insinuat- introduced tortuously, from the verb insinuare, from in- in + sinuare to curve.
